intro: Pelea inotricha, commonly known as the hairy pelea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or brown, arranged in a compact cluster, and bloom during the dry season. Pelea inotricha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low moisture conditions.
